parameters.name: service_token
parameters.description: Your service api key with 3scale (also known as service token).

parameters.name: service_id
parameters.description: Service id. Required.

parameters.name: access_token
parameters.description: OAuth token used for authorizing if you don't use client_id with client_secret.

parameters.name: app_id
parameters.description: Client Id (identifier of the application if the auth. pattern is OAuth, note that client_id == app_id)

parameters.name: referrer
parameters.description: Referrer IP Address or Domain. Required only if referrer filtering is enabled. If special value '*' (wildcard) is passed, the referrer check is bypassed.

parameters.name: usage
parameters.description: Predicted Usage. Actual usage will need to be reported with a report or an authrep.

parameters.name: redirect_url
parameters.description: Optional redirect URL for OAuth. Will be validated if sent.

parameters.name: redirect_uri
parameters.description: Optional redirect URI for OAuth. This is the same as 'redirect_url', but if used you should expect a matching 'redirect_uri' response field.

get.summary: AuthRep (Authorize + Report for the API Key authentication pattern)

parameters.name: service_token
parameters.description: Your service api key with 3scale (also known as service token).

parameters.name: service_id
parameters.description: Service id. Required.

parameters.name: user_key
parameters.description: User Key (identifier and shared secret of the application if the auth. pattern is Api Key)

parameters.name: referrer
parameters.description: Referrer IP Address or Domain. Required only if referrer filtering is enabled. If special value '*' (wildcard) is passed, the referrer check is bypassed.

parameters.name: usage
parameters.description: Usage will increment the metrics with the values passed. The value can be only a positive integer (e.g. 1, 50). Reporting usage[hits]=1 will increment the hits counter by +1.
